instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1465: What is A1465? A1465 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2924, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00164, 820-3208, 820-3435..
definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3057: What is 820-3057? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MagSafe LED off. No recharge.
threads.message:
Good evening,
I have a MacBook Air 11 "<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EMC 2631 where the MagSafe LED is off and does not charge.
The Mac had suffered a liquid damage (coffee), and I already changed the battery because the other was HS
But the MAC refuses to charge more than 8%.
On Mac OS X, the battery icon is lightning-free and indicates 100%, but if I unplug the charger, the Mac turns off.
If I run the diagnostics at startup by pressing D, the Mac asks me to connect the charger while it is done and tells me 8% this time for the battery.
In all cases the charger LED is off.
I tried to change the card of the connector MagSafe, the one that is connected later to the motherboard, by a MacBook Air 13 "because same connector but same problem in the end.
I have a voltage of 8.5V at the battery connector in all cases.
Cordially.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MagSafe LED off. No recharge.
threads.message:
Battery will not get charge if Magsafe light is not present.
Check <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> line level.
Also check continuity with <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> from LIO board.

Use <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3057</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LIO schematic (paired with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) as refference...
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1VcyoXrQEej_hZ0WT2oQaEhxvZcCW2tVW[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MagSafe LED off. No recharge.
threads.message: I ended up changing the MagSafe card + the flexible interconnect mat and it's gone again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MagSafe LED off. No recharge.
threads.message:
"Check <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> line level.
Also check continuity with <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> from LIO board."
You didn't reply: so no idea if your LIO connector is good...
